UPS just DMed me the sad truth: "We went over your tracking number and it shows the package has returned to the local facility. Unfortunately, was not possible to deliver today. Our local team will be working with our driver to deliver on Monday, we apologize for the wait."
It did. That was where we first became friends.
I did!
@Kereminde Sigh.
@UPS I’ve DMed you Joseph. Let me know if it’s coming or not!
@billamend Always.
Sometimes not even that.

Now they’ve just sent me an email, subject: UPS Update: Package Scheduled for Delivery Today, and it absolutely promises that the package is on its way and will definitely arrive by 7pm on Saturday. Meanwhile the truck and map have vanished from the app. They’re toying with me.

On closer examination the truck appears just to be parked  for the night at the Kingston NY UPS facility. I think all the app’s promises that My Package is Very Close and Definitely Still On Its Way To Me are well-meaning fibs.
I’m still in there with a chance. There’s a little truck showing up on the App about 10 miles away. Fingers very crossed.

How late should one stop refreshing the UPS app that promises that the thing you are waiting for will arrive by 7 pm and realise that there are no lost UPS trucks out there, with a lone driver determined that I'll get my package before they knock off for the night? (It's 9:15 pm)

I just signed books for the @GoldenNotebook1. So many books.  Big books, small books. They'll put up a web page you can order them from.  So for all the people who've asked how to get signed books, the answer is, from a little independent bookshop in Woodstock NY.
